sub_title: Managing capacity building on Impact Measurement & Management (IMM) and Investment Readiness (IR) for the Impact-Linked Fund (ILF) for Water, Sanitation & Hygiene (WASH)
summary:
Passionate about a broad range of themes related to responsible natural resource management, nature conservation and sustainable production & consumption patterns attached to it. About making it possible, through research, start-ups/scale-ups and (impact) investments. 

My current work focus is on scaling enterprises active in the WASH sector and increasing their impact. I do this within my position at Aqua for All as Technical Assistance (TA) Manager for the Impact-Linked Fund for Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (ILF for WASH), a follow-up the ‘Social Impact Incentives (SIINC) for WASH’ programme. In this role, I'm responsible for designing and managing all TA activities that are part of ILF for WASH. The full focus of the TA is on Impact Measurement & Management (IMM) and Investment Readiness (IR). 

ILF for WASH is co-designed and implemented by Aqua for All and our partner Roots of Impact. The purpose is to provide (financial) rewards to enterprises that create (more/better/faster) positive social and environmental impact (additionality). The payments are based on the achievement of pre-defined outcomes and incentivise enterprises to further deepen their impact whilst, at the same time, enabling them to raise private investment and scale. In other words, the enterprise receives “better terms for better impact”.

My added value lies in my broad view and empathy, my analytic attitude, writing and presentation skills, and in my approach to relation & stakeholder management. 

I have the ability to quickly put information in the right context, smoothly coordinate projects, I work thoroughly with a great eye for detail, am flexible and I master three languages (Native Dutch, Full Professional English and Limited Working Spanish). I love to interact with different types of people and manage ad hoc situations.

I am curious by nature, dedicated, flexible and I love to interact with different types of people. 

Knowledgeable about: 
Impact Investing |  International Relations | Monitoring, Evaluation & Learning (MEL)/Impact Reporting | Network Organizations | Project Coordination | Project Development | Public-Private Partnerships | Stakeholder Analysis | Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) | Qualitative Research | Water Management.

Things I love to do include acting, traveling, listening to music, dancing (Lindy Hop), watching documentaries and spending time with friends. Other things I enjoy a lot: going to festivals, reading historical novels and playing piano. 

Feel free to contact me to have a chat about ideas, suggestions, advice or mutual interests!

Managing capacity building on Impact Measurement & Management (IMM) and Investment Readiness (IR) for the Impact-Linked Fund (ILF) for Water, Sanitation & Hygiene (WASH)

profile_positions.description:
Aqua for All is an international foundation working towards catalysing public and private capital for the water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) sector in Africa and Asia. We do this by supporting innovative business models and scaling local entrepreneurs to grow their businesses in a sustainable manner (via grants, technical assistance and outcome/results-based funding), while we also use our funds to facilitate (local) public and private investments in viable water and sanitation solutions (via first & second loss capital and guarantees).

In my role of TA Manager ILF for WASH, I'm responsible for designing and managing all technical assistance (TA) activities that are part of the Impact-Linked Fund for Water, Sanitation and Hygiene (ILF for WASH), a follow-up of Aqua for All’s ‘Social Impact Incentives (SIINC) Programme’. The full focus of TA is on Impact Measurement & Management (IMM) and Investment Readiness (IR). The TA activities include a Train-the-Trainer (TTT) programme (for service providers, e.g. accelerators), an ILF-readiness bootcamp (for enterprises) and tailored Foundational Support (for enterprises). 

ILF for WASH is co-designed and implemented by Aqua for All and our partner Roots of Impact. The purpose is to provide (financial) rewards to enterprises that create (more/better/faster) positive social and environmental impact (additionality). The payments are based on the achievement of pre-defined outcomes and incentivise enterprises to further deepen their impact whilst, at the same time, enabling them to raise private investment and scale. In other words, the enterprise receives “better terms for better impact”.
profile_positions.title: Technical Assistance (TA) Manager Impact-Linked Fund (ILF) for Water, Sanitation & Hygiene (WASH)

profile_positions.description:
Working for a dynamic public private network organisation for the Dutch water sector: the Netherlands Water Partnership (NWP). 

Responsible for programme management of KIFFWA (Kenya Innovative Finance Facility for Water) that I've helped to establish and that I've witnessed to successfully evolve over time. My main focus is on grant management, proposal writing, reporting, stakeholder management, contract management with third parties, and Monitoring & Evaluation (M&E).
profile_positions.title: Programme Manager KIFFWA & Coordinator East Africa (Ethiopia, Kenya, Rwanda)

profile_positions.description:
Working for a dynamic public private network organisation for the Dutch water sector: the Netherlands Water Partnership (NWP). 

One of the programmes I work on is the later: the Kenya Innovative Finance Facility for Water (KIFFWA), a project development facility in Kenya supported by the Dutch Embassy in Nairobi. KIFFWA provides early stage capital and finance expertise to support the creation of viable water investment opportunities and attract private investors. See: www.kiffwa.com.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager East Africa (incl. KIFFWA)

profile_positions.description:
Working for a dynamic public private network organisation for the Dutch water sector: the Netherlands Water Partnership (NWP). 

Globally too much, too little and too dirty water pose great challenges. NWP is convinced that by working together we can contribute to solving these problems. Nationally, but also internationally. Because water does not stop at borders. Within the NWP network private companies, NGOs, knowledge institutions and governmental organizations collaborate to achieve more impact abroad. The global water challenges offer opportunities for the Dutch water sector; that is why NWP shares knowledge, organizes matchmaking and increases the sector’s visibility (conferences, missions, etc.). NWP is also co-executor of governmental programmes such as Partners for Water and the Young Expert Programmes (YEP). 

Within NWP, my main activities concern project- and relation management for two programmes: 

1) KIFFWA (the Kenya Innovative Finance Facility for Water), a project development facility in Kenya supported by the Dutch Embassy in Nairobi. KIFFWA provides early stage capital and finance expertise to support the creation of viable water investment opportunities and attract private investors. See: www.kiffwa.com.

2) The Water Support Programme supports Dutch embassies and the Dutch water sector in the field of water development cooperation as well as business opportunities. Within NWP,  I am responsible for the coordination of activities on Ethiopia, Kenya and Rwanda. 
See: https://www.netherlandswaterpartnership.com/water-support-programme; https://www.netherlandswaterpartnership.com/country/ethiopia; https://www.netherlandswaterpartnership.com/country/kenya;
https://www.netherlandswaterpartnership.com/country/rwanda
profile_positions.title: Project Officer KIFFWA & Water Support Programme | Ethiopia, Kenya, Rwanda

profile_positions.description: In this position I supervise high school students who have a one day field experience at a town hall, in developing project plans for their municipality.
profile_positions.title: Program Supervisor

profile_positions.description:
In this position I focus on research, educational and organizational activities. 
Regarding research activities, I am currently involved in a research on issues encountered in the transport of detainees, commissioned by the Dutch Ministry of Security and Justice. Before, I assisted dr. Karin Lasthuizen in designing and writing a NWO proposal for a 4-year research that focuses on the integrity of Dutch politicians within, throughout and as a result of collective political decision-making processes. 
Furthermore, regarding educational activities, I help assessing student assignments. 
Finally, I assisted in organizing a small conference on Public and Political Leadership (PUPOL).
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant at the Governance Department

profile_positions.description:
As Director-General High School Program I am responsible for the acquisition of participants (schools/students), the organization of a training program (both substance and logistics), the development of a 'train the trainer'-program and the organization of a concluding small conference that together constitute the ingredients of the High School Program as one of the educational projects of United Netherlands. United Netherlands is an internationally-orientated foundation that aims to create an educational platform for talented, motivated and ambitious young people.

Overall, the High School Program aims to offer an innovating, educational and specialized short training program for high school students with the emphasis on internationalization of education. The central theme is 'Model United Nations' (MUN) which refers to a simulation of the United Nations. Through the development of this concept students with diverse interests have the opportunity to practice skills like public speaking, negotiation and active listening, in addition to (already) acquire theoretical knowledge about relevant scientific disciplines like International Relations and International Law. In short: various essential elements for the simulation of representing a country position in the system of the United Nations.
profile_positions.title: Director-General High School Program

profile_positions.location: Palangka Raya Area, Central Kalimantan, Indonesia
profile_positions.description: For this graduation project, I conducted ethnographic field research (interviews and focus groups with traditional chiefs and heads of villages) commissioned by the Dutch office of the World Wildlife Fund (WWF). The goal of the research is to assess the socio-economic potential for ecotourism development in the Sebangau National Park, with emphasis on popular support.
profile_positions.title: Graduation Project 'Ecotourism Potential in Sebangau National Park'

volunteer_experiences.description: With pleasure I spent time each 2/3 weeks with a Syrian young mother. We chat in Dutch about different things in our lives and do things like relaxing in the park with our kids and learning to ride a bike.
With much joy, I assisted a Syrian person on a weekly basis in learning the Dutch language, in order to help him pass his social/civic integration exam.

Hier (Dutch for ‘Here‘) is the name of a large Dutch climate program whose fundamental idea it is to stress the immediate necessity to implement adaptation projects and initiatives to climate change. Hier introduces a new brand uniting and representing all initiatives that reduce the risk of climate change. This campaign involves not only national charity organisations, but also government and businesses.

Teater '77 is a theater group/association for amateur actors, based in Breda. Besides being a member and acting myself, I have joined the board in order to think along with regard to creative direction (events) and communication (promotion) of the group.
